response.overview: An anthology that presents 13 short films born from a one-day Rainbopedia workshop, showcasing the breadth of queer life. From Leon, a trans photographer shaping political art, to Mark, who unravels his father’s chance encounter with Noël Coward; Carol’s vivid memories of LA’s punk and leather bar scene; and performance artist John Fleck’s irreverent self-portrait after being targeted by Senator Jesse Helms—these voices are at once touching, funny, provocative, and profound. Together, they offer a layered portrait of queer experience while inviting audiences to share their own stories for Rainbopedia’s global LGBTQ+ archive.
response.title: Storytellers: An Oral History Anthology
